title: Leadership Practical Competency Enhancement: Social Creativity Development Through Artistic Experimentation and Improvisational Research

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for corporate management/HR/administrative staff

learning_goals: Learners can develop social problem-solving frameworks by designing artistic experiments as spontaneous research methods.

Learners propose three or more specific action plans applying creative thinking techniques (e.g., brainstorming, design thinking) in organizational work environments (e.g., project management, team collaboration) through a 2-week practice-based research process and achieve a suitability score of 80% or higher via peer evaluation and instructor feedback.

Learners form teams of three in 2-week participatory learning activities to analyze three nonlinear problems based on real-world work cases (e.g., project delays, budget overruns) and derive solutions through collaborative experimentation (e.g., brainstorming, simulations), achieving 4+ points (on a 5-point scale) in at least two of three evaluation rubric criteria (creativity, feasibility, collaboration efficiency).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
